data.prayer: Father, let love abound more and more in the church of Siquijor, Philippines.
data.verse: And this is my prayer: that your love may abound more and more in knowledge and depth of insight

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Siquijor, Philippines
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, please equip every disciple to make disciples who make disciples in the state of Siquijor.
data.verse: And the things you have heard me say in the presence of many witnesses entrust to reliable people who will also be qualified to teach others.

data.prayer: Spirit, help the fearful in Siquijor, Philippines to submit to God and resist the devil.
data.verse: Submit yourselves, then, to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

data.prayer: Please, teach the 1,908 believers in Siquijor, Philippines how to pray to you and how to listen for your voice. That they might follow you into the good works you have prepared for them.
data.verse: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.

data.prayer: Lord, bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. Lead the South Asian, general people in paths that they don’t know. Make darkness light before them and crooked places straight. Do not forsake the South Asian, general people.
Pour your Spirit out on the 13,700 citizens of Siquijor, Philippines, so that they might know your name and the name of your Son.
data.verse: And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions.

data.prayer: Father, convict the 1,908 believers in Siquijor to be holy and righteous. Inspire them to gather in small groups for accountability and spiritual growth.
Father, make bold the prophets in Siquijor, Philippines so that the church can be equipped with truth and insight and a vision of your heart.
data.verse: These are the things which you should do: speak the truth to one another; judge with truth and judgment for peace in your gates.
